name: ECON 101
title: Managerial Economics
description: Analysis of the theory and practice of decision making in business firms, applying the concepts and techniques of microeconomics. Topics may include pricing schemes, non-price competition, internal organization of firms, incentive contracts, asymmetric information, and game theory. Case studies are used to illustrate some topics.

pre_req_data.text: Prerequisite(s): ECON 100A or ECON 100M; and ECON 113.
